episodeTitle: So Long, Marine Base! The Final Battle for Freedom
description: The Straw Hat Pirates execute their final escape from the G-8 Marine Fortress. When Vice Admiral Jonathan's low-tide trap grounds the Going Merry, the crew uses salvaged Skypiean technology—an Impact Dial, Breath Dials, and Flame Dials—to launch their ship into the air with an Octopus Balloon. Despite Jonathan's strategic brilliance, the Straw Hats successfully escape, earning his reluctant respect.

events.title: Jonathan's 9 O'Clock Trap Activated
events.description: Vice Admiral Jonathan implements his strategic '9 o'clock trap,' using the base's knowledge of tidal patterns to strand ships in the harbor. The Going Merry becomes grounded during low tide on the harbor floor, leaving the Straw Hats seemingly unable to escape.
events.significance: Demonstrates Jonathan's tactical brilliance and creates the episode's central conflict, forcing the crew to use creative problem-solving rather than combat to escape.

quotes.speaker: Jonathan
quotes.context: Jonathan believes he has finally trapped the Straw Hat Pirates with his low-tide strategy

events.title: Impact Dial Used to Launch Going Merry
events.description: The Straw Hats use the Impact Dial they obtained from Skypiea to propel the Going Merry upward from the grounded harbor floor. This creative application of Skypiean technology allows them to overcome Jonathan's tide-based trap.
events.significance: Showcases the crew's resourcefulness and demonstrates practical use of items from the previous arc (Skypiea), maintaining continuity despite this being a filler episode.

events.title: Octopus Balloon Reinflated with Skypiean Dials
events.description: The crew uses Breath Dials and Flame Dials from Skypiea to reinflate the Octopus Balloon, allowing the Going Merry to float in the air above the Marine fortress. This demonstrates their continued ingenuity in applying Skypiean technology.
events.significance: Continues the theme of using items from previous adventures to overcome new challenges, and shows the Straw Hats' ability to adapt and improvise under pressure.

events.title: Shepherd's Bazooka Backfires
events.description: Inspector Shepherd, in his eagerness to stop the escaping pirates, fires his bazooka at the Octopus Balloon. However, his shot goes wide and instead destroys the Marine cannons that were being prepared to shoot down the balloon, inadvertently helping the Straw Hats escape.
events.significance: Provides comic relief while demonstrating Shepherd's incompetence, continuing the running gag of his character undermining Marine efforts throughout the arc. This moment perfectly encapsulates the arc's humor and lighter tone.

events.title: Jonathan Accepts the Straw Hats' Victory
events.description: Vice Admiral Jonathan, witnessing the Straw Hats' successful escape using the Octopus Balloon, acknowledges their victory and chooses not to pursue further aggressive action. He accepts defeat with grace, recognizing the pirates' cleverness and determination.
events.significance: Showcases Jonathan's character as a reasonable and honorable antagonist, setting him apart from typical One Piece villains. His acceptance demonstrates respect for worthy opponents and strategic thinking over blind aggression.

quotes.text: They've won. The Straw Hat Pirates have successfully escaped G-8.
quotes.speaker: Jonathan
quotes.context: Jonathan gracefully accepts the pirates' escape, showing respect for their ingenuity

events.title: Shepherd Threatens G-8 Decommissioning
events.description: Inspector Shepherd, angry that the Straw Hats escaped despite his presence, threatens to recommend G-8 for decommissioning in his report to Marine Headquarters, blaming the base's perceived incompetence.
events.significance: Demonstrates Shepherd's petty nature and his concern with appearances over actual effectiveness, creating tension before his comeuppance.

events.title: Jessica Punches Shepherd
events.description: Jessica, the head chef and Jonathan's wife, punches Inspector Shepherd in response to his threats about decommissioning G-8. This act of defiance protects her husband's base and demonstrates her loyalty.
events.significance: Provides a satisfying conclusion to Shepherd's character arc, giving him his deserved comeuppance. Also showcases Jessica's strong personality and her protective nature toward both Jonathan and the G-8 base.

events.title: Jonathan's Speech About the Bonding Experience
events.description: Vice Admiral Jonathan addresses his Marines, explaining that the Straw Hat Pirates' presence brought G-8 together and provided valuable training and team-building experience. He reframes their 'failure' to capture the pirates as a success in strengthening the base.
events.significance: Provides thematic closure to the arc by emphasizing growth, camaraderie, and learning over winning or losing. Jonathan's perspective demonstrates mature leadership and offers a positive interpretation of the events.

quotes.text: The pirates brought G-8 and its inhabitants together, and gave them some much needed exercise.
quotes.speaker: Jonathan
quotes.context: Jonathan explains the positive impact of the Straw Hats' presence to his wife Jessica

events.title: Straw Hats Successfully Escape G-8
events.description: The Going Merry floats away from the G-8 Marine Fortress using the Octopus Balloon, successfully escaping the heavily fortified base. The crew celebrates their freedom as they leave Navarone Island behind.
events.significance: Marks the end of the G-8 Arc and the crew's return to their journey. This successful escape demonstrates the crew's growth in teamwork and problem-solving without relying solely on combat.

quotes.speaker: Jonathan
quotes.context: Jonathan believes his low-tide trap has finally cornered the Straw Hats

quotes.text: They've won. The Straw Hat Pirates have successfully escaped G-8.
quotes.speaker: Jonathan
quotes.context: Jonathan gracefully accepts the pirates' escape

quotes.text: The pirates brought G-8 and its inhabitants together, and gave them some much needed exercise.
quotes.speaker: Jonathan
quotes.context: Jonathan reflects on the positive impact of the Straw Hats' presence

themes.description: The episode emphasizes clever problem-solving and resourcefulness over brute force. The Straw Hats escape not through combat, but by creatively using Skypiean technology.
themes.symbolism: The Impact Dial and Octopus Balloon represent the value of knowledge and tools from previous adventures, showing how experiences build upon each other.

themes.description: Jonathan and the Straw Hats maintain mutual respect throughout the arc. Despite being enemies, both sides recognize each other's abilities and part without true animosity.
themes.symbolism: Jonathan's graceful acceptance of defeat and his positive reframing of the experience symbolize the possibility of honorable conflict without hatred.

themes.description: Jonathan explains that the Straw Hats' presence strengthened G-8 by forcing the Marines to work together and improve their skills. Challenges, even 'failures,' can lead to growth.
themes.symbolism: The arc itself, despite being filler, enriches the overall One Piece narrative by exploring Marine perspectives and showcasing non-combat problem-solving.

characterSpotlights.role: Main antagonist who accepts defeat gracefully
characterSpotlights.development: Jonathan's character arc concludes with him demonstrating mature leadership by reframing the Straw Hats' escape as a learning experience rather than a failure.
keyActions: Accepts the Straw Hats' victory with grace
Explains to his Marines how the experience strengthened G-8
quotes: They've won. The Straw Hat Pirates have successfully escaped G-8.
The pirates brought G-8 and its inhabitants together, and gave them some much needed exercise.

characterSpotlights.role: Key strategist in the escape plan
characterSpotlights.development: Usopp's knowledge of the Impact Dial and understanding of how to use Skypiean technology proves crucial to the escape.
keyActions: Helps deploy the Impact Dial to launch the Going Merry
Assists in reinflating the Octopus Balloon with Breath and Flame Dials

characterSpotlights.development: Shepherd's incompetence reaches its peak as he accidentally helps the Straw Hats escape, then gets punched by Jessica for his threats.
keyActions: Accidentally destroys Marine cannons while trying to shoot down the Octopus Balloon

characterSpotlights.development: Jessica demonstrates her loyalty to Jonathan and G-8 by physically confronting Shepherd.
keyActions: Punches Inspector Shepherd for threatening G-8

mangaDifferences.difference: The entire G-8 Arc (episodes 196-206) is anime-original and does not appear in the manga. This episode and the entire arc were created by Toei Animation as filler content.

trivia.fact: Episode 206 is the last episode of One Piece to be produced in 4:3 aspect ratio. Starting with episode 207, the series transitioned to 16:9 widescreen format.
This episode marks the final use of the opening theme 'BON VOYAGE!' by Bon-Bon Blanco, which had been used since episode 169.

This episode marks the final use of the ending theme 'Dreamship' by Aiko Ikuta. This ending theme was exclusive to the G-8 Arc (episodes 196-206), making it the only ending theme used exclusively during a filler arc.
The G-8 Arc was originally conceived as a theatrical film, according to series director Konosuke Uda in 2019.
Episode 206 has an IMDb rating of 7.5/10 based on user reviews, indicating positive reception for the arc's conclusion.
Vice Admiral Jonathan is named after the novel 'Jonathan Livingston Seagull' by Richard Bach.
Despite being a filler arc, the G-8 Arc was acknowledged in the 'Episode of Merry' special, making it the only anime-original story to receive such recognition.
